title: champions before and after reworks available
body:
hey everybody,

Just wanted to know if there are more people who dont like all the reworked champions.
Maybe riot (it's never gonna happen) can rerelease the old champions... like old aatrox, akali, katarina, ryze, irelia and others, next to the new reworked once.
just thought that was a good idea, what you all thinking?

replies.body:
That would cause major clarity issues. 

Imagine going into a match where you know you're facing Akali, but you don't know if you're facing current or old Akali. 

I've suggested that Riot release a legacy client where players can download old patches and they can run custom games from a local server. ... That's also never going to happen.

This suggestion has been made alot of times, but it is not gonna happen.

These champions got reworked for a good reason.

the champions get Reworked because their kits are not healthy for the game.
they are not coming back, stop asking for them it's legitimately unsightly that people want to play shit that is blatantly unfair and poorly designed.

> [{quoted}](name=2gudaiya,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaX6QT1G,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2020-01-02T11:44:06.550+0000)
>
> the champions get Reworked because their kits are not healthy for the game.
> they are not coming back, stop asking for them it's legitimately unsightly that people want to play shit that is blatantly unfair and poorly designed.

so is every champion if you know how to play them

> [{quoted}](name=firewelp,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaX6QT1G,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2020-01-02T21:21:43.004+0000)
>
> so is every champion if you know how to play them

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

They're not bringing back the old reworks. Period.

Unless the new rework is somehow *more* of a failure than the pre-rework (*none* of the champions on live are like that right now) *and* they retained the same assets, Riot does not revert reworks. **Especially** not if the rework was done because they were removing a cancerous part of their kit.
Akali was clearly a failure since they had to do so much shit to get her somewhat balanced

> [{quoted}](name=T2K Baka,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaX6QT1G,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2020-01-02T11:35:22.346+0000)
>
> Akali was clearly a failure since they had to do so much shit to get her somewhat balanced

then every champion is a failure because every champ has had mechanics removed from them over their lifetimes.

I don't think every champ has invisibility for tower on reworks, I'm just saying a lot of people consider it a failure, she has so much tweaking just to make it somewhat ok to play against her. She is fun to play even now, but still has some unfair mechanics. Maybe my definition of a failure for reworks might be different or wrong

> [{quoted}](name=T2K Baka,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaX6QT1G,comment-id=0003000000010000,timestamp=2020-01-02T11:59:52.606+0000)
>
> I don't think every champ has invisibility for tower on reworks, I'm just saying a lot of people consider it a failure, she has so much tweaking just to make it somewhat ok to play against her. She is fun to play even now, but still has some unfair mechanics. Maybe my definition of a failure for reworks might be different or wrong

jax had dodge chance way back when and could just dodge anything on the map including fountain lazer. 
minted reworked akali with true stealth would not have stood a chance against him. 
so stop, worse things have happened, every champion is now a failure by your metric.

Her rework fixed some of her problems (most notably her losing everything against ranged champions until level 6, then autowinning as soon as she hit 6 as long as she didn't int), and just because you have to do more stuff to get a champion balanced doesn't mean the rework was a failure.

An actual failure of a rework would be something like LB (introduced more problems, didn't really fix previous problems, *and* made her feel like shit for everyone involved). Akali...has problems, but she's not a *failure* of a rework.
She has a LOT of problems, even now she still has some. Lb on the other hand wasn't that bad, if you got used to her.

I do like some of the the new reworks.
But id give my left nut to play old yorick again.
